items.name: ObjectManager
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: ObjectManager # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class ObjectManager ###* * Stores the current default ObjectManager. * @property current * @type gs.ObjectManager * @static ### @current: null ###* * Manages game objects by updating if necessary and offering * methods to add or remove game objects. All game objects are sorted by * the order-property to give control over the update-order. * * A game object can registered under a unique ID and then easily accessed using * that ID. If an object gets registered, a global variable $ is created * as well. However, that global variable is only for the use in property-bindings * used for In-Game UI. See ui.Component_BindingHandler. * * In addition, a game object can be assigned to a group like for example * a set of UI toggle-buttons can be assigned to the same group and then * easily accessed later using gs.ObjectManager.objectsByGroup method. * * @module gs * @class ObjectManager * @memberof gs * @constructor * @see ui.Component_BindingHandler ### constructor: -> ###* * All game objects to manage. * @property objects * @type gs.Object_Base[] ### @objects = [] ###* * All game objects by ID. * @property objectsById * @type Object ### @objectsById = {} ###* * All game objects by group. * @property objectsByGroup_ * @type Object ### @objectsByGroup_ = {} ###* * Indicates if the ObjectManager is active. If false the game objects are not updated. * @property active * @type boolean ### @active = yes ###* * Indicates if the ObjectManager needs to sort the game objects. * @property active * @type boolean ### @needsSort = yes ###* * Disposes the manager and all assigned game objects. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> for object in @objects if not object.disposed object.dispose() ###* * Disposes all assigned game objects. * * @method disposeObjects ### disposeObjects: -> keys = Object.keys(@objectsById) for k in keys object = @objectsById[k] if object and not object.disposed object.dispose() ###* * Registers an object. * * @method registerObject ### registerObject: (object) -> if object.id? if !@objectsById[object.id] @objectsById[object.id] = [] @objectsById[object.id].push(object) # FIXME: Should be handled by UiManager since it is UI specific. window["$"+object.id] = object ###* * Unregisters an object. * * @method unregisterObject ### unregisterObject: (object) -> if object?.id? objects = @objectsById[object.id] if objects objects.remove(object) if objects.length > 0 window["$"+object.id] = objects.last() else delete window["$"+object.id] return null ###* * Adds a game object to the manager. The game object is then automatically updated by the manager. * * @method addObject * @param {gs.Object_Base} object - The game object to add. ### addObject: (object) -> @add(object) ###* * Removes a game object to the manager. The game object is then no longer automatically updated or disposed by the manager. * * @method removeObject * @param {gs.Object_Base} object - The game object to remove. ### removeObject: (object) -> @remove(object) ###* * Adds a game object to the manager. The game object is then automatically updated by the manager. * * @method add * @param {gs.Object_Base} object - The game object to add. ### add: (object) -> #@objects.splice(0, 0, object) @objects.push(object) @needsSort = yes @registerObject(object) @addToGroup(object, object.group) ###* * Removes a game object to the manager. The game object is then no longer automatically updated or disposed by the manager. * * @method remove * @param {gs.Object_Base} object - The game object to remove. ### remove: (object) -> if object @objects.remove(object) @unregisterObject(object) if object.group? @objectsByGroup[object.group]?.remove(object) ###* * Gets an object by ID. * * @method objectById * @param {String} id - The ID of the game object to get. * @return {gs.Object_Base} The game object or null if no game object is registered for the specified ID. ### objectById: (id) -> @objectsById[id]?.last() ###* * Gets an object by ID. * * @method byId * @param {String} id - The ID of the game object to get. * @return {gs.Object_Base} The game object or null if no game object is registered for the specified ID. ### byId: (id) -> @objectsById[id]?.last() ###* * Sets the object for an ID. * * @method setObjectById * @param {gs.Object_Base} object - The game object to set. * @param {String} id - The ID for the game object. ### setObjectById: (object, id) -> object.id = id if !@objectsById[id] @objectsById[id] = [object] else @objectsById[id].push(object) window["$"+id] = object ###* * Adds an object to a specified object-group. * * @method addToGroup * @param {gs.Object_Base} object - The game object to add. * @param {String} group - The group to assign game object to. ### addToGroup: (object, group) -> if group? @objectsByGroup_[object.group]?.remove(object) if !@objectsByGroup_[group] @objectsByGroup_[group] = [] @objectsByGroup_[group].push(object) ###* * Gets all object of a specified object-group. * * @method objectsByGroup * @param {String} group - The object-group. * @return {gs.Object_Base[]} The game objects belonging to the specified group. ### objectsByGroup: (group) -> @objectsByGroup_[group] || [] ###* * Updates the manager and all assigned game objects in the right order. * * @method update ### update: -> i = 0 if @needsSort @objects.sort (a, b) -> if a.order < b.order return 1 else if a.order > b.order return -1 else return 0 @needsSort = no while i < @objects.length object = @objects[i] if object.disposed @removeObject(object) else object.update() if object.active i++ return null gs.ObjectManager = ObjectManager #new ObjectManager()
